title: Part a. [0â€“4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points (i. 2 points; ii. 1 point; iii. 1 point)

i. 2 points

1 point: Using the expression for the flux of a uniform field:
ğ›· = Bâ¦A

1 point: Substituting
ğ›· =abB0

ii. 1 point: Using the expression relating the emf and flux:

Ïµ = âˆ’ d Ï• d t

Both the field and area are constant, so â„‡ = zero

iii. 1 point: Since there is no emf there is no current in the loop, and thus no magnetic force exerted on the loop.

title: Part b. [0â€“2]
stimulusHtml:
2 points

When ğœ”t = ğœ‹ / 2, B = B0 cos ğœ‹ / 2 = zero, i.e., the field has been decreasing, and is about to change direction. The induced current will be in a direction to oppose this change, i.e., clockwise.
descriptions:
No points earned.

When ğœ”t = ğœ‹ / 2, B = B0 cos ğœ‹ / 2 = zero, i.e., the field has been decreasing, and is about to change direction. The induced current will be in a direction to oppose this change, i.e., clockwise.

Earns 1 of 2 points

title: Part c. [0â€“9]
stimulusHtml:
9 points (i. 4 points; ii. 3 points; iii. 2 points)

i. 4 points

1 point: Calculating the flux:

Î¦ = abB0 cos Ï‰t

1 point: Calculating the emf:

Îµ=âˆ’ dÎ¦ dt (negative sign not required)

= abÏ‰B0 sin Ï‰t

1 point: Using Ohm's Law:

I-Îµ/R

1 point:

I = a b Ï‰ B 0 R â€‰ sin   Ï‰ t

ii. 3 points

1 point: For a graph showing a period of 2ğœ‹

1 point: For a graph consistent with answer to c.i.

1 point: For correct orientation of current ğœ‹ / 2 consistent with answer to b. (i.e., graph positive at ğœ‹ / 2 if clockwise current in b.; graph negative at ğœ‹ / 2 if counterclockwise current in b.)

iii. 2 points

The maximum value of the current occurs with sin ğt = 1.

I m a x = a b Ï‰ B 0 R

1 point: For indicating the coefficient of the sin (or cos) term in c.i.

1 point: For the correct answer (i.e., the coefficient in c.i. must be correct)
